summary: This document appears to be a summary or memo regarding a call with Susan Shelling, a transcriptionist, discussing her work processes and the handling of transcripts for legal cases. It mentions the sale of Consor & Associates, the destruction of her notes, and the transcript distribution process. The document is addressed to Assistant United States Attorney Andrew Rohrbach and is subject to a protective order.

persons.name: Susan Shelling
persons.context: Participant in a call discussing her transcription work processes, including how she handles notes and transcripts for legal cases.

persons.name: Andrew Rohrbach
persons.context: Recipient of the document/correspondence; a federal prosecutor in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Call with Susan Shelling
events.description: A call was held with transcriptionist Susan Shelling to discuss her work processes, including the sale of Consor & Associates, her signature recognition, and the handling/destruction of her notes and transcripts.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Susan Shelling, a transcriptionist, stated she has destroyed all her notes related to her work.
The original and a copy of transcripts would go out to the attorneys involved, and she sends transcriptions to a company for formal transcript production.
She does not have a copy of the full transcript and no longer retains her notes.
The document is addressed to Assistant U.S. Attorney Andrew Rohrbach and is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs.
The document references the sale of 'Consor & Associates, US Legal Services'.
